titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Davies/Scroggie Collection of Yukon Correspondence and Records
Davies/Scroggie Collection of Yukon Correspondence and Records
titlestmt.author: by Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 30, 2019 at 03:01

did.unittitle: Davies/Scroggie collection of Yukon correspondence and records

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, receipts and other records that document business and commerce in the vicinity of Dawson, Yukon Territory, in the early twentieth century. The bulk of the material spans the dates 1906 to 1913, with one letter from 1903. The Bank of British North America correspondence documents the activity of the Dawson branch and includes correspondence from grocers, wholesalers, miners, jewelers, and insurance and real estate agents. Landahl's Emporium correspondence documents the wholesale and retail purchase and sale of goods. The Canadian Department of the Interior Records consist of reimbursement receipts and receipts for mining permit fees, documenting the survey and inspection of mining and timber resources in Yukon Territory.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Carole-Ann Scroggie Davies and Grant Davies, 1995.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Davies/Scroggie Collection of Yukon Correspondence and Records is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Davies/Scroggie Collection of Yukon Correspondence and Records. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections [as they are acquired], and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, in 2012. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call number: Uncat WA MS 223.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, receipts and other records that document business and commerce in the vicinity of Dawson, Yukon Territory in the early twentieth century. The bulk of the material spans the dates 1906 to 1913, with one letter from 1903. The Bank of British North America correspondence documents the activity of the Dawson branch and includes correspondence from grocers, wholesalers, miners, jewelers, and insurance and real estate agents. Landahl's Emporium correspondence documents the wholesale and retail purchase and sale of goods. The Department of the Interior Records consist of reimbursement receipts and receipts for mining permit fees, documenting the survey and inspection of mining and timber resources in Yukon Territory.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Bank of British North America Correspondence, 1903-1913. II. Landahl's Emporium Correspondence, 1907-1913. III. Canadian Department of the Interior Records, 1910.

did.unittitle: Bank of British North America Correspondence

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Incoming and Outgoing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under three headings by region: North America, Europe, and Unidentified and Unsorted Locations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Incoming and Outgoing.

did.unittitle: Canadian Department of the Interior Records
